function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Algal blooms may produce phytotoxins and hepatotoxins, leading to water contamination and health risks for humans and animals.","Impact":"Water contamination, potential illness, and health risks for humans and animals.","Mitigation":"Regular monitoring and testing of water bodies, implementation of water treatment technologies, and public awareness campaigns.","Technologies":"Advanced water treatment technologies, such as ultraviolet (UV) disinfection and ozone treatment.","People":"Humans, animals, water management authorities, and public health agencies.","Owner":"Water management authorities and public health agencies."},{"Description":"Neurotoxins produced by algal blooms can affect the nervous system of exposed organisms, leading to severe health effects and potential fatality.","Impact":"Severe health effects, potential fatality, and neurodegenerative diseases in humans and animals.","Mitigation":"Strict regulations on water use, public health advisories, and prohibition of recreational activities in affected water bodies.","Technologies":"Water quality monitoring technologies and early warning systems for toxin detection.","People":"Humans, animals, recreational water users, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Public health authorities and environmental protection agencies."},{"Description":"Algal blooms in urban ponds may pose less of a threat to humans, but still require monitoring and management to prevent any potential risks.","Impact":"Potential contamination and health risks in urban areas.","Mitigation":"Urban pond management and maintenance, public education on potential risks, and regular testing for water quality.","Technologies":"Urban pond management techniques, such as aeration and biological treatments.","People":"Urban residents, pets, and local environmental authorities.","Owner":"Local environmental authorities and urban planning committees."}]}
